Generation I.Red: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
Generation I.Yellow: A team of triplets that can burrow over 60 MPH . Due to this, some people think it's an earthquake.
Generation I.Stadium: Diglett triplets that always travel together. Known to burrow more than 60 miles underground and trigger quakes.

Generation II.Gold: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
Generation II.Silver: Extremely powerful, they can Dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles .
Generation II.Crystal: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it's like underground.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Extremely powerful, they can Dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
Generation III.Sapphire: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
Generation III.Emerald: Because the triplets originally split from one body, they think exactly alike. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly through the ground.
Generation III.FireRed: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation IV.Pearl: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation IV.Platinum: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles .

Generation V.Black: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation V.White: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation V.Black 2: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation V.White 2: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .

Generation VI.X: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
Generation VI.Y: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles .
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.

Generation VII.Sun: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.
Generation VII.Moon: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: They're referred to as triplets, but they're not identical—the metallic elements in their bodies differ slightly. The proof shows in their whiskers!
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: They're referred to as triplets, but they're not identical—the metallic elements in their bodies differ slightly. The proof shows in their whiskers!

Generation VIII.Sword: Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of protective helmet on their heads, and they also function as highly precise sensors.
Generation VIII.Shield: The three of them get along very well. Through their formidable teamwork, they defeat powerful opponents.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles .

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
Generation IX.Violet: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it’s not very fast, but it has the power to dig through even the hardest bedrock.
